author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Jalahalli police are on the lookout for a physical education teacher of a private school who allegedly sexually abused a Class 9 student for months.

The school authorities approached the police on Wednesday and filed a complaint. It is suspected that the teacher had misbehaved with other girls in the class as well.

According to the police, he may have sexually assaulted the 14-year-old girl from the beginning of the academic year. The accused, identified as Lakshmikantha, allegedly took the girl to his house on numerous occasions and sexually abused her. This is said to have continued till November.

Girl allegedly threatened

The girl told the police that she could not confide in her parents or teachers as he had threatened her with dire consequences if she did so, a senior police officer told The Hindu . However, the school authorities found out about the abuse recently when the girl’s classmates informed a teacher about it.

The school called Lakshmikantha seeking an explanation and initiated a probe by the school’s Child Protection Committee, following which the teacher went missing.

The accused is suspected to have sexually assaulted his 14-year-old student from the beginning of the academic year
title: Bengaluru teacher accused of sexual assault on the run
